result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reanna M. Moon

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
SEH for 10/31/22 adjourned to 12/14/22 at 2:30 pm on court's motion; court unavailable on previously scheduled date.  Confirming email sent to parties.

01:31 PM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Reanna M. Moon, appeared in custody with Attorney Xavier Solis.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:  22CF229/21CM867.   Victim rights compliance. Family member appears on behalf of the victim. Matter is resolved and agreement is placed on the record.

21CM867: On the State's motion, case is dismissed and read in.

22CF340: Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On State's motion, count 2 is dismissed. Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Family of Jamie L. J., Theresa B., Robert M. and Craig G.

08:59 AM  Attorney Daniel Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Reanna M. Moon, appeared in custody with Attorney Xavier Solis.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF229/21CM867.  Victim rights compliance. Attorney Solis is requesting an adjournment so he may discuss resolution with the State. State does not object. Court will adjourn. Bond motion in Case 22CF229. Arguments heard; State objects. Court will grant the bond motion; Bond in 22CF229 is modified down to $99,999.00 cash bond with the same conditions. If DE does not comply with the Living Free Program requirements the State may request to modify bond back to the original amount. Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
RE ROTATION
Bond Motion set for 8/11/2022 at 8:45 am.
to Modify Bond.

10:03 AM Defendant Reanna M. Moon appeared by phone means and in-custody. Attorney Xavier Solis in court for Defendant Reanna M. Moon.
Prosecuting Atty Thomas Binger appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Karen Howell.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
21CM867 & 22CFF229:
Victim rights compliance.
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time.
Matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:45 am.

01:49 PM
Attorney Xavier Solis appeared for the Defendant, Reanna M. Moon.  Defendant in-custody.
Attorney Carli McNiell appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance and Robert M. present in court.
Arguments heard on the bond motion; motion is denied.
STC hrg 6/10/2022 at 10:00 am.
Bond Motion set for 4/25/2022 at 1:45 pm.
Defts Motion To Modify Bond

09:12 AM
 Defendant Reanna M. Moon appeared by phone means and in-custody.
Prosecuting Atty Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
21CM867 & 22CF229:
Victim rights compliance.
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, rec'd offer, needs more time.
Matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Reanna M. Moon appeared with Attorney Xavier Solis.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Court questions Atty Solis on his non - appearance and reason why he did not appear.   Court admonishes Atty Solis for not informing court of non -appearance issue earlier before previous hearing.  No further action.

Defendant Reanna M. Moon appeared with Attorney Xavier Solis.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Reanna M. Moon in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  Intake Clerk received an email from Atty Solis at 10:05 stating he was just appointed and wanted to ask for adjournment. Court had clerk send messagse back asking if Atty Solis was going to appear in person and request this and notified Atty Solis he is possibly going to be held in contempt..   Atty Solis informs Court at 10:35 that he will not appear in person.   DE informed of Atty Solis not appearing today.    DE waives time for preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.  New PH scheduled along with a Order to Show Cause Hearing for Atty Solis.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 10:40 am.
filed by Atty. Xavier Solis  kmk
